trans-unit.source: Because of ongoing development, the Android SDK version installed in Eclipse might not match the version in the code.
trans-unit.target: Because of ongoing development, the Android SDK version installed in Eclipse might not match the version in the code.

trans-unit.source: The Android SDK referenced in this tutorial is version 21, the latest at the time of writing.
trans-unit.target: The Android SDK referenced in this tutorial is version 21, the latest at the time of writing.

trans-unit.source: The version number may increase as new releases of the SDK appear, and we recomend using the latest version available.
trans-unit.target: The version number may increase as new releases of the SDK appear, and we recomend using the latest version available.

trans-unit.source: Two symptoms of version mismatch are:
trans-unit.target: Two symptoms of version mismatch are:

trans-unit.source: Look in the Eclipse Console in the bottom pane.
trans-unit.target: Look in the Eclipse Console in the bottom pane.

trans-unit.source: You may see error messages of the form "Unable to resolve target 'android-n'".
trans-unit.target: You may see error messages of the form "Unable to resolve target 'android-n'".

trans-unit.source: Standard Android objects in code that should resolve based on import statements may be generating error messages.
trans-unit.target: Standard Android objects in code that should resolve based on import statements may be generating error messages.

trans-unit.source: If either of these appear, the version of the Android SDK installed in Eclipse might not match the SDK target of the downloaded project.
trans-unit.target: If either of these appear, the version of the Android SDK installed in Eclipse might not match the SDK target of the downloaded project.

trans-unit.source: To verify the version, make the following changes:
trans-unit.target: To verify the version, make the following changes:

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, click Window, then click Android SDK Manager.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, click Window, then click Android SDK Manager.

trans-unit.source: If you have not installed the latest version of the SDK Platform, then click to install it.
trans-unit.target: If you have not installed the latest version of the SDK Platform, then click to install it.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the version number.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the version number.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that in the uses-sdk element, the targetSdkVersion is set to the latest version installed.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that in the uses-sdk element, the targetSdkVersion is set to the latest version installed.

trans-unit.source: The uses-sdk tag might look like this:
trans-unit.target: The uses-sdk tag might look like this:

trans-unit.source: In the Eclipse Package Explorer right-click the project node, choose Properties, and in the left column choose Android.
trans-unit.target: In the Eclipse Package Explorer right-click the project node, choose Properties, and in the left column choose Android.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the Project Build Target is set to the same SDK version as the targetSdkVersion.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the Project Build Target is set to the same SDK version as the targetSdkVersion.
